sourceDesc.p:
If Chinese, the text below is based on the Taishō text from the CBETA-Database (Version Feb.2006). If Pāli, the text base is the VRI Chaṭṭa Saṅgāyana edition (ver.3). If Sanskrit the text base is Enomoto, Fumio 榎本文雄 (1994): A comprehensive study of the Chinese Saṃyuktāgama: Indic texts corresponding to the Chinese Saṃyuktāgama as found in the Sarvāstivāda-Mūlasarvāstivāda literature. Kyoto: Kacho Junior College
and other scholarly publications (as referenced). English translations by Marcus Bingenheimer.

projectDesc.p: This file has been created in the project "A Digital Comparative Edition of the Bieyi za ahan jing" conducted at the Chung-hwa Institute for Buddhist Studies 中華佛學研究所 and the Dharma Drum Buddhist College 法鼓佛教研修學院. The project was funded by the Chiang Ching-kuo Foundation for International Scholarly Exchange 蔣經國國際學術交流基金會. The aim of the project was to produce a comparative digital edition and partial translation of the 364 sutras of the BZA and their parallels. In the original interface, the texts were kept in an eXist database and are realized via XQuery and XSLT as HTML for the online user. The project lasted from 2005-2009.

div.p: From Ernst Waldschmidt: Drei Fragmente buddhistischer Sūtras aus den Turfan-handschriften. NAWG 1968.1, 3-26. Reprinted in AKS: 232-255. This is part of the text-cluster of BZA (T.100) sutra 012.
1 (evaṃ mayā srutam | ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavāṃ śrāvastyāṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍadasyārāme |)
2 (athāyuṣmata ānandasya ekākino rahasi gatasya pratisaṃlīnasyaivaṃ cetasi cetaḥparivitarka udapādicetaḥparivitarka bis trīṇi ist im. III. Fragment (unten S. 23) V5 belegt.|)
3 (trīṇy etāni gandhajātāni yeṣāṃ gandhajātānām anuvātaṃ gandho vāti na prativātam | katamāni trīṇi | tadyathā mūlagandhaḥ sāraga)V 1ndhaḥ puṣpagandhaḥ |

10 katarat tad ānanda gandhajātaṃ yas(ya gandhajātasya anuvātam api gandho vā)ti prativātam api anuvātapraR 2tivātam api gandho vāti |

11 ihānanda anyatarasmiṃ grāme vā nigame vā strī vā puru(ṣo vā prativasati śīlavāṃ kalyāṇa)dharma yāvajjīvaṃ prāṇātipātātR 2: °pātaprativirataḥ; in R 4 °pātāt prativirataḥ; diese richtigere Lesart ist hier eingesetzt worden.praR 3tivirataḥ adattādānātDie Ergänzung (śīlavāṃ kalyāṇa)dharma(ḥ) stützt sich auf sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo in der Pāli-Entsprechung; sie ist nicht unbedingt gesichert.kāmamithyācārād mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapra(mādasthānāt prativirataḥ |)

12 (tasya ye te di)gvidikṣu saṃtaḥ samyaggatāḥ satyaR 4rūpā varṇaṃ bhāṣaṃte | amuṣmiṃ grāme vā nigame vā strī vā puruṣo vā pr(at)i(vasati śīlavāṃ kalyāṇadharmaḥ |) yāva(jjīvaṃ) prāṇātipātāt prativirataḥ adattā(dā)R 5nāt kāmamithyācārād mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānāt prativi(rataḥ |)

13 (tad eva ānanda gandhajātaṃ)Es ist interessant, daß der Buddha in der stark abweichenden Version des Gandha-sūtra, deren chinesische Übersetzung im Tsêng-i-a-han-ching (Ekottarāgama) erhalten ist, drei Arten von Duft nennt, die sich auch gegen den Wind verbreiten: es sind der Duft der Tugend, der Duft der Gelehrsamkeit und der Duft der Freigebigkeit; vgl. T. I, Bd. 2, S. 613b Z. 5 v.l.yasya gandhajātasya anuvātam api gandho vāti pra(tivātam api anuvātaprativātam api gandho vāti |)
14 (tasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavāṃ gāthā babhāṣe |)Die Strophen in den Absätzen 15--19 sind, wie oben ausgeführt, aus Udānavarga VI. 16--20 übernommen.
